t: Psalm 102
Prayer of an Afflicted Man for Mercy on Himself and on Zion.
A Prayer of the Afflicted when he is faint and pours out his complaint before the Lord.
Hear*pn my prayer, O Lord!*s And*ln let my cry for help come to You.
Do*ln not hide Your face from me in the day of my distress; Incline*ln Your ear to me; In*ln the day when I call answer me quickly.
For*ln my days have been consumed in smoke, And*ln my bones have been scorched like a hearth.
My*ln heart has been smitten like grass and has withered away, Indeed,*ln I forget to eat my bread.
Because*ln of the loudness of my groaning My*ln bones cling to my flesh.
I*ln resemble a pelican of the wilderness; I*ln have become like an owl of the waste places.
I*ln lie awake, I*ln have become like a lonely bird on a housetop.
My*ln enemies have reproached me all day long; Those*ln who deride me have used my name*i as a curse.
For*ln I have eaten ashes like bread And*ln mingled my drink with weeping
Because*ln of Your indignation and Your wrath, For*ln You have lifted me up and cast me away.
My*ln days are like a lengthened shadow, And*ln I wither away like grass.
But*ln You, O Lord,*s abide forever, And*ln Your name to all generations.
You*ln will arise and*i have compassion on Zion; For*ln it is time to be gracious to her, For*ln the appointed time has come.
Surely*ln Your servants find pleasure in her stones And*ln feel pity for her dust.
So*ln the nations will fear the name of the Lord*s And*ln all the kings of the earth Your glory.
For*ln the Lord*s has built up Zion; He*ln has appeared in His glory.
He*ln has regarded the prayer of the destitute And*ln has not despised their prayer.
This*ln will be written for the generation to come, That*ln a people yet to be created may praise the Lord.*s
For*ln He looked down from His holy height; From*ln heaven the Lord*s gazed upon the earth,
To*ln hear the groaning of the prisoner, To*ln set free those who were doomed to death,
That*ln men*i may tell of the name of the Lord*s in Zion And*ln His praise in Jerusalem,
When*ln the peoples are gathered together, And*ln the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.*s
He*ln has weakened my strength in the way; He*ln has shortened my days.
I*ln say, “O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days, Your*ln years are throughout all generations.
Of*ln old You founded the earth, And*ln the heavens are the work of Your hands.
Even*ln they will perish, but You endure; And*ln all of them will wear out like a garment; Like*ln clothing You will change them and they will be changed.
But*ln You are the same, And*ln Your years will not come to an end.
The*ln children of Your servants will continue, And*ln their descendants will be established before You.”
